title: Israeli Labor Party
summary: The Israeli Labor Party (Hebrew: מִפְלֶגֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִית‎, romanized: Mifleget HaAvoda HaYisrelit ), commonly known as HaAvoda (Hebrew: הָעֲבוֹדָה‎, lit. 'The Labor'), is a social democratic[8][9][10][11] and Zionist[11][12] political party in Israel. The party was established in 1968 by a merger of Mapai, Ahdut HaAvoda, and Rafi. Until 1977, all Israeli Prime Ministers were affiliated with the Labor movement.[13] The current party leader is Merav Michaeli, who was elected in January 2021.
